Detailed Description

The main class to controlling the entire action.

Definition at line 541 of file LibAlgoSim.h.

Member Function Documentation

void appmain::betweenStep (  ) 

This is called by algorithm base class after user algo completes each step; it performs the operations between each step.

It first sends a NEXTSTEP message(to all listeners of state using eventsender) and then sends the current state(using the same mechanism).

Then it loops indefinetly for keyboard input. space for next step; f of F for forward in memory b or B for backward and finally q for quit.

Definition at line 50 of file appmain.cpp.

state appmain::GetPrevState (  ) 

gives the previous state relative to current state. If none then sets the stepname of the state to "NULL"

void appmain::Init ( IAlgoSim *  sim  ) 

Initialises the simulation by calling get functions to get pointers to it's correspondig algorithm, blackboard and animation class
It starts all the threads and clears the memory

Parameters:
sim pointer to the loaded simulation class
